articles.headline: Supreme Court Limits Police Powers to Seize Private Property
articles.snippet: Civil forfeiture laws, a popular way to raise revenue, have been the subject of criticism across the political spectrum.
articles.abstract: Civil forfeiture laws, a popular way to raise revenue, have been the subject of criticism across the political spectrum.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court ruled on Wednesday that the Constitution places limits on the ability of states and localities to take and keep cash, cars, houses and other private property used to commit crimes.
articles.byline: By Adam Liptak and Shaila Dewan

articles.headline: What’s Next for Smartphones? Samsung’s New Galaxy Line Offers a Few Answers
articles.snippet: One of the company’s newly unveiled models works with 5G wireless networks. Another folds up like a book.
articles.abstract: One of the company’s newly unveiled models works with 5G wireless networks. Another folds up like a book.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — It’s hard to imagine how smartphones could get much better. Most are already zippy and equipped with jumbo screens, powerful cameras and face scanners.

articles.headline: Fed Explains Pause as Officials Debate Future Rate Increases
articles.snippet: The Fed released minutes of its January meeting showing officials continued to express confidence in the economy but saw enough warning signs to warrant a pause in rate increases.
articles.abstract: The Fed released minutes of its January meeting showing officials continued to express confidence in the economy but saw enough warning signs to warrant a pause in rate increases.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal Reserve officials decided in late January to pause their steady campaign to raise interest rates as the global economic outlook became less certain and financial markets failed to appreciate the Fed’s willingness to shift if the economy weakened, according to the minutes of that meeting released on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Huawei Risks to Britain Can Be Blunted, U.K. Official Says, in a Rebuff to U.S.
articles.snippet: A top security official outlined an alternative approach to the Trump administration’s call to keep the Chinese company Huawei out of 5G networks.
articles.abstract: A top security official outlined an alternative approach to the Trump administration’s call to keep the Chinese company Huawei out of 5G networks.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The Trump administration has spent a year trying to convince America’s allies in Europe that the Chinese telecommunications giant Huawei is a grave threat to their national security and should not be allowed any role in developing new wireless networks.

articles.headline: A Staggering Exodus: Millions of Venezuelans Are Leaving the Country, on Foot
articles.snippet: Venezuelans are fleeing the country’s economic crisis, with more than three million people leaving the country in recent years in search of food, medicine and water.
articles.abstract: Venezuelans are fleeing the country’s economic crisis, with more than three million people leaving the country in recent years in search of food, medicine and water.
articles.lead_paragraph: PAMPLONA, Colombia — The walking began before dawn: before the clouds broke against the mountaintops, before the trucks took over the highway, even before anyone in the town woke up to check the vacant lot where scores of Venezuelan refugees had been huddling through the night.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Casey and Jenny Carolina González

articles.headline: Advertisers Boycott YouTube After Pedophiles Swarm Comments on Videos of Children
articles.snippet: Google said it had deleted the accounts and channels of people leaving the comments in question, but acknowledged “there’s more to be done.”
articles.abstract: Google said it had deleted the accounts and channels of people leaving the comments in question, but acknowledged “there’s more to be done.”
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Nestlé, Epic Games and other major brands said on Wednesday that they had stopped buying advertisements on YouTube after their ads appeared on children’s videos where pedophiles had infiltrated the comment sections.
articles.byline: By Daisuke Wakabayashi and Sapna Maheshwari

articles.headline: Inside a Fly-by-Night Operation to Harvest Ballots in North Carolina
articles.snippet: With a congressional seat in the balance, sworn testimony this week has illuminated the inner workings of an amateurish operation that paid workers to collect absentee ballots.
articles.abstract: With a congressional seat in the balance, sworn testimony this week has illuminated the inner workings of an amateurish operation that paid workers to collect absentee ballots.
articles.lead_paragraph: RALEIGH, N.C. — Kelly Hendrix was recruited into an illicit effort to sway a congressional race by a customer at the fast-food restaurant where she worked.

articles.headline: Pope Opens Meeting on Clerical Sex Abuse Under Great Pressure From Victims for Change
articles.snippet: Addressing 190 bishops and Roman Catholic Church leaders from around the world, Francis said the faithful were owed “concrete and effective measures.”
articles.abstract: Addressing 190 bishops and Roman Catholic Church leaders from around the world, Francis said the faithful were owed “concrete and effective measures.”
articles.lead_paragraph: VATICAN CITY — Cloistered inside the Vatican on Thursday, Roman Catholic Church leaders heard searing prerecorded video testimonials from abuse survivors, including one made pregnant three times by a priest who started abusing her at age 15, beat her and forced her to have abortions.

articles.headline: A Green New Deal Is Technologically Possible. Its Political Prospects Are Another Question.
articles.snippet: The technology is feasible for a Green New Deal, though experts doubt its goals could be accomplished as quickly as advocates hope. Finding money and political will is a bigger challenge.
articles.abstract: The technology is feasible for a Green New Deal, though experts doubt its goals could be accomplished as quickly as advocates hope. Finding money and political will is a bigger challenge.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump derided the Green New Deal as a “high school term paper that got a low mark.” Congressional Republicans mocked it as “zany.” Even Nancy Pelosi, the Democratic House speaker, called the proposal a “green dream,” and some of the party’s 2020 candidates are starting to describe it as merely aspirational.
articles.byline: By Lisa Friedman and Trip Gabriel
